solution_line_template: At his first speed, Kevin ran {first_speed} miles per hour * {first_duration} hours = <<{first_speed}*{first_duration}={first_distance}>>{first_distance} miles.
At his second speed, he ran {second_speed} miles per hour * {second_duration} hours = <<{second_speed}*{second_duration}={second_distance}>>{second_distance} miles.

15 minutes is a quarter of an hour so at his third speed, he ran {third_speed} miles per hour * {third_duration_hours} hours = <<{third_speed}*{third_duration_hours}={third_distance}>>{third_distance} miles.

Therefore, Kevin ran a total of {first_distance} miles + {second_distance} miles + {third_distance} miles = <<{first_distance}+{second_distance}+{third_distance}={total_distance}>>{total_distance} miles.
